comments.author: Alistar Folfies

comments.text:
+Golden Freddy Wrong.  Most pure abilities are blocked by spell immunity. 
 If the ability specifically pieces spell immunity and does pure damage 
then the damage will go through.

Spell immunity blocked most abilities and gives 100% magic resistance.  So 
anything that does pure or physical damage and goes through spell immunity 
does the damage.
comments.author: Anrealic

comments.text:
Any spells/attacks that are pure. Or just read the type.












You're like Freddy..
comments.author: Gaming Gamer Wolf

comments.text:
dota2(dot)gamepedia(dot)com(slash)Spell_Immunity#List_of_abilities_that_pierce_spell_immunity
<3
comments.author: TigerKirby215

comments.text: Too much to name :b
comments.author: Conor Harris

comments.text:
+Rajiv Aiyar If the ability does physical damage and pierces spell immunity 
then the damage and effect will go through. If it does magic damage the 
damage will be blocked(Primal Roar, Reverse Polarity, Black Hole), if it 
does pure damage the full effect will go through.

These are only for if the ability pieces magic immunity.  Also im fairly 
certain physical abilities cant piece magic immunity because it doesnt 
include them(Except for slardar's stun because it does physical damage but 
the stun doesnt go through spell immunity)
comments.author: Anrealic

comments.text:
Let's see. 
Episode 42
Juggenaut -> Tidehunter
1-0

Episode 43
Crystal Maiden -> Timbersaw
1-1

Episode 44
Axe -> Phoenix
2-1

Episode 45
Axe-> Crystal Maiden
Dire Tower -> Axe
Tidehunter-> Kunkka
Timbersaw-> Phoenix
4-3

Episode 46
Satyr -> Axe, Rubick
4-5

Episode 47
Kunkka -> Tidehunter
Kunkka -> Crystal Maiden
Juggernaut -> Enigma
Juggernaut -> Phoenix
8-5 (wow that one really went bad for dire)

Episode 48
Timbersaw -> Crystal Maiden
Rubick-> Enigma
Terrorblade -> Timbersaw (does this even count?)
Phoenix -> Rubick
Terrorblade-> Juggernaut
10-8

Episide 49
Crystal Maiden- > Kunkka
Crystal Maiden  -> Axe
Timbersaw -> Enigma
Timbersaw -> Crystal Maiden
12-10 (not sure how Timbersaw bloodstone activation would go)

So it's 12-10.  Also noteworthy that Terrorblade hasn't died yet.

comments.text:
+ForDeath16 Announcer items are cosmetic items replace the voice responses 
of the default announcer. They can equipped in the loadout window. Like HUD 
Skins, Announcers can be shared with team-mates through the Shared Content 
panel.(preferably copypasted)

Does this answer your question? /s
Damn it has some orthography issues. http://dota2.gamepedia.com/Announcers
comments.author: DarkAngelJAIR

comments.author: ForDeath16

comments.text:
+ForDeath16 Creeps are a type of unit within Dota 2 that heroes can 
interact with, but do not have direct control over by default (see Chen, 
Enchantress and Helm of the Dominator). There are two types of creeps: lane 
creeps and neutral creeps. Both types of creeps can be killed by players 
for gold and experience. Allied creeps at low health can be denied to 
reduce the bounty given to enemies.

Does this answer your question?

captions.text: NIGEL: Hello and welcome to a new Dota 2 Report.
Last time I was able to join the actual game
and control one of the Dire heroes.
TERRORBLADE: It was nice to battle with you guys.
I'm going back to my single player PvE farm game now.
NIGEL: And my next order of business now that I'm part of this game
ENIGMA: Oh yeah, we have two couriers.
NIGEL: I know too well how it is to be a pitiful, grounded courier.
TIDEHUNTER: You're like a parrot, HEH!
ANNOUNCER: Radiant's middle tower is under attack!
KUNKKA: Damn it all, I STILL can't time that right.
TIDEHUNTER: Tidehunter get revenge on Kunkka!
ENIGMA: Wow. That was shockingly one sided.
TIDEHUNTER: Friends help kill Kunkka again!
NIGEL: Yes, that went very smoothly. Nice Ravage, Tidehunter.
TIDEHUNTER: *gasp* Bird is talking, he he.
There was absolutely no ebb and flow to that fight at all.
We just sort of ran over them.
...I don't know what this feeling is.
NIGEL: Shall we push the middle lane?
TB ILLUSION: Hey, so, Terrorblade just asked me to  ask you
what item you think he should buy next.
ENIGMA: Uh, pfft... A Black King Bar I guess? Sure.
TB ILLUSION: Oh! What's that do?
ENIGMA: It's great, it gives you strength, damage,
and it can be activated to give you spell immunity and magic resistance!
TB ILLUSION: Nice! That sounds great. So I'd be immune to all spells, then?
There are a few spell piercing exceptions.
ENIGMA: Did you use any other spells after using Ravage?
ENIGMA: Well you see, Rubick is able to steal the last spell you used.
ENIGMA: Which means he just stole Ravage.
That's some montage-worthy shit right there, eh, Rubick?
TIMBERSAW: I think it's about 'Bloodstone o'clock'
Buy a Soul Ring and the Bloodstone recipe.
Okay! Now bring that shit up here to the Secret Shop!
TIMBERSAW: Hey hey! I'M using the courier! Hands off!
TIMBERSAW: Oh come on you're right there in the base
To combine them to create the Bloodstone!
The health and mana regenration of the Bloodstone
will allow me to decimate my enemies.
They won't know what hit them!
And if things get too dicey, I can kill myself!

title: The DOTA 2 Reporter Ep. 49: Bloody Hail
